intro: Auriculardisia nigropunctata, commonly known as the black-punctured ear orchid, is a rare and striking orchid species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its unique ear-shaped petals and sepals, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, dark purple flowers that bloom during the rainy season. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating, which helps in moisture retention. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
